review.reviewBody:
The fact that this is considered a ski/snowboard jacket is laughable. 

The material is so incredibly thin, and the insulation is basically nothing. One minor fall onto hard snow or ice and the jacket's outer layer would rip to shreds. 

It's super cute and I thought I could trust Shawn White's brand, but this is a definite no. Not worth your money and won't keep you warm during cold ski days. I considered keeping it as a regular winter jacket but decided it wasn't even worth it.
review.name: NOT a ski jacket and NOT warm

review.reviewBody: Loved this jacket! Comfortable, stylish, and kept me warm the whole ski trip! Runs big. Normally a medium and got a small.
review.name: Love!!

review.reviewBody: So cute just not practical from a skiing perspective. No powder belt/cord to close the bottom, super thin, no inside pockets, and very cropped. But SO cute.
review.name: Super cute just impractical

review.reviewBody: Great price, probably only good for spring or sunny day winter sports, great color. For the price I thought it would be perfect. Not happy that there isn’t a waist cinch…not practical for ski look.
review.name: Where’s the waist cinch?

review.reviewBody:
Aesthetically this jacket rocks. I was sold when I read in the description that the waist cinches to keep in the cold.
Unfortunately, the jacket arrived and there is no waist cinch making it pretty impractical for keeping warm on the slopes.
For those who don’t care about the waist cinch, the color in the less saturated photos is more true to life, which I was hoping was the case.
review.name: Cute but not practical

review.reviewBody: I was looking at all the jackets and then I saw this model wearing the sh#% out of this jacket and I was like… YES i wanna be like that chick I want that jacket. It was like 20% jacket 80% that chick just wearing the sh%# out of that jacket.
review.name: What a great jacket

name: Cropped Puffer Jacket - Women's

review.reviewBody:
Patagonia had a great idea by having a small ribbon sewn inside the waist ban that can be tightened and loosened to act as a belt.

However, the ribbon's attachment point came undone quickly and the entire ribbon came out of the waist band. Feeding the ribbon back into the waistband and repositioning/reattaching it would have been a royal pain the @$$, so I gave it back to be repaired.

When I received the fixed product, I wore it for 2 days before the ribbon once again detached at its attachment point.

I am in the process of exchanging these for a different style of pants (one that has belt loops)
review.name: Poor built-in belt system

review.reviewBody:
I love the pants, I actually am ordering a second pair as Im writing this review. I love that these are made from recycled/repurposed fishing nets, and certified as such - this means something to me from a value perspective and its worth me choosing this pair of pants over a few of the competitors out there because of just the sustainability aspect. 

Minor Negatives: 
1) The 'belt' webbing does not stay in place and its constantly loosening at the hips (not to big of a deal because the pants are a good fit on my hips
2) The 'belt' webbing end finds itself lost in a very tiny hole and when that happens its really really hard to retrieve (and if you do not, you cannot fasten the webbing to tighten on your waste). 

Positives: 
1) SO COMFORTABLE I CANNOT EVEN EXPLAIN 
2) The material is soft and doesnt do that thing where it looks completely different after the first wash and dry
review.name: Sustainable Comfort w/ Movement

review.reviewBody: Good material. I cut a short hole (1/4” slice) in mine shortly after getting them and the fabric hasn’t frayed around the cut. Also a good design, very functional except for the waist adjustment. The drawstring only goes part way around the waist and unevenly bunches up the extra material over the right hip.
review.name: Good pants, stupid waist adjustment

name: RPS Rock Pant - Men's

review.reviewBody:
Coghlan?s Cast Iron Broilers are great for cooking all sorts of foods
from snacks to main courses to dessert. Made with pre-seasoned cast
iron for cooking over the heavy heat of campfires or barbecues. The
open slots on each side of these broilers let grease escape. These
Broilers are made for cooking burgers but are also great for cooking
chicken, steaks, veggies, and much more. Removable handles and
the open-hinged design make the Broilers easy to take apart and
reassemble for simple cleaning and convenient storage. The staycool
wooden handles and locking s-clips ensure that your cooking
experience is comfortable and hassle-free. Available in a single or
double size.
? Handle Length: 20.4" (52 cm)
? Instruction and recipe book included
review.name: Not just for Burgers!

review.reviewBody: Wow!  Bought this for the 2024 Wakaan 4 Day musical festival in Ozark, AR and the bench was a huge social, happy gathering spot, was used to the max!  Many people inquired as to where the bench was purchased.  It serves as a great space blocker, sitting low to the ground is comfortable/nice, can easily store your belongings under it, can sit alone with your things next to you if you want a little space to yourself or if a cool friend/person walks by, you can say yo... come sit next to me a minute :). Super light, super easy to fold up and roll/go...  Absolutely amazing purchase, design.  Thanks Coleman :)
review.name: Best bench ever - slay!

review.reviewBody: Light, easy to carry, my wife and our Jack Rustle find it comfortable for concert's and events. Folds easily and looks great with wooden arms, kind of a mid-century modern lounge chair. Oh and I wasn't sure about the slightly lower height but it's a winner. I don't have to worry about ticking off the folks I set up in front of, and kids like the down to their level position. This chair is a winner!
review.name: Festival Lounge in Style

review.reviewBody: This bench is EVERYTHING around the fire pit - at the campground or just in the backyard! Very sturdy for two and lightweight.
review.name: If you're thinking about it...GET IT!

name: Living Collection Bench

review.itemreviewed: WP Insulated Knuckle Guard Secure Cuff Glove - Men's
review.reviewBody: Warm and definitely water proof . Best gloves I ever owned
review.name: Perfect gloves

review.itemreviewed: WP Insulated Knuckle Guard Secure Cuff Glove - Men's
review.reviewBody:
Not good for actual winter use (read as "more than standing outside for 15 minutes"). 

40 minutes riding my bike in the winter and I was almost frostbitten in my finger tips. Had to stop and try to warm my hands up multiple times on a 6.5 mile ride...

Dangerous to use these to keep your hand warm in serious weather.
review.name: Terrible winter performance.

review.itemreviewed: WP Insulated Knuckle Guard Secure Cuff Glove - Men's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] They already ripped from the finger tips the feel good but also not air breathable hands get sweaty but they keep the water out that's good I work in freezer trail making deliveries food service so I touch lots of metal equipment

review.itemreviewed: WP Insulated Knuckle Guard Secure Cuff Glove - Men's
review.reviewBody: Great gloves i do roofing and climbing trees to put up christmas lights with them and, there still in tact of about 2 weeks of use easy to slip on and off too, wouldn't try to use a phone while you have these on though

review.itemreviewed: WP Insulated Knuckle Guard Secure Cuff Glove - Men's
review.reviewBody: Terrible quality the finger tips were ripped to shreads in first week
review.name: Terrible quality

review.itemreviewed: WP Insulated Knuckle Guard Secure Cuff Glove - Men's
review.reviewBody: Nice and thick but they don't keep my fingers warm AT ALL!! There are little air gaps in the sides. Ugh, very disappointed with my purchase. I thought "Carhartt" right, they put out great winter gear! My son in law used to work outside and had nothing but Carhartt gear and swore by it. Mmm, I don't think I'll buy Carhartt just because of the name again.
review.name: Very disappointed

review.itemreviewed: WP Insulated Knuckle Guard Secure Cuff Glove - Men's
review.reviewBody:
I fuel up cargo jets at the airport and these gloves literally fell apart in just about a month, I was pretty disappointed in them.  Seams started to split after 2 weeks and the non leather panels on the palm cracked and peeled off.  Around 3 weeks the tips of the middle and index fingers began to breach, and by week 5 my fingers became fully exposed.

They were pretty comfortable before they started falling apart but I couldn’t recommend them as work gloves given how short lived they were
review.name: Mediocre

review.itemreviewed: WP Insulated Knuckle Guard Secure Cuff Glove - Men's
review.reviewBody: It carries the carhart name but not the abilities. I bought these for work. Im a highway employee. I needed something tough and warm. These failed to provide any warmth. They are tough, if you can get them on. Everytime i remove them, the inside fabric feels like it will come out. I have a hard time reinserting my fingers in their individual openings. If that wasnt enough, they smell. From day one, the outside rubber parts stink. Worse yet, sweat in them or get them wet. They smell horrific. The odor stays on your hands after removing them. Once again im on the hunt for a good outdoor work glove. These are not the ones.
review.name: Bad in cold. Bad odor.

review.itemreviewed: WP Insulated Knuckle Guard Secure Cuff Glove - Men's
review.reviewBody: Love them. They replaced a twenty year old pair of gloves.
review.name: Excellent purchase.

review.itemreviewed: WP Insulated Knuckle Guard Secure Cuff Glove - Men's
review.reviewBody: Not to bad for the money but get soaked fast in wet snow. But good to salt with washes right off. But the pads don't last long. I'd purchase again just to run equipment loader, bob cat And stuff . But not for out side in rain heavy snow or to Cold.
review.name: Not to bad for the price but not for to wet or to cold .

name: WP Insulated Knuckle Guard Secure Cuff Glove - Men's

review.reviewBody: Was excited to get this jacket for my son as I loved the color, style and extendable sleeves for growth. We read reviews that the jacket was ‘oversized’ but went with his true size, 10/12. He is 10 1/2 yrs old / tall and skinny but this jacket fit more like an XL 14/16. For context, I am 5’6” and I easily could put jacket on. I would say size down 1 maybe two sizes. Will be returning jacket.
review.name: Medium 10/12 - more like an XL 14/16

review.reviewBody: If you’ve owned a Barbour in the past, you’re going to want to skip this whole disappointing experience. I ordered this particular style of jacket because I under the impression it was still one of the few that are made in England. But no, it was made in Moldova, It also doesn’t have the same heft as my original jacket and the sleeves have a crappy synthetic lining that makes you sweat immediately unlike the old lining that was the Barbour tartan all the way through. Really too bad, and obviously returning. Wishing I had the foresight twenty years ago to buy my old one with a more oversized fit but even fitted it’s light years better than this pathetic new version.
review.name: Not your old Barbour

review.reviewBody: Really liked it but very tight across shoulders,  not for women that are broad shouldered or with muscular arms

review.reviewBody: Super comfy and stylish. I was on the edge of sending them back as they were almost too short but I have kept and after one wear they have a bit of give and feel perfect. I have work them to the office with tights and for walking in.
review.name: Great boots

review.reviewBody: These boots are perfect. I have wide feet and plantar fasciitis. I ordered a half size up and they fit perfectly. My fascia does get a little sore after walking in them for an entire day, but not enough to cause me severe pain. They are slim, attractive, and beautiful. I just can’t get enough of the aesthetic. I tie the laces around the hooks about 3 times to shorten them before tying. Anyway, they’re absolutely amazing and worth the risk of ordering shoes online!
review.name: Absolutely Amazing. Beautiful. Comfortable.

review.reviewBody: Super comfortable from the second I put them on. I can work a 12 hour day on my feet and still feel good in these boots. They are more sleek and less chunky than combat boot brands. I have gotten a ton of compliments on them.
review.name: Buy These Boots

review.reviewBody: I really like the look of the Women's Hi-Line. I need to use them more to see how the light color holds up to more frequent use. I've discovered the boot rubs on my heel just enough to result in a blister and I am hoping if I adjust how tightly I lace the boot, it won't happen going forward.
review.name: Attractive. Light. Need some getting used to.

review.reviewBody: These boots are gorgeous. Their matte finish is elegant. They are cut in a way that makes my foot look thin - a rare quality to achieve. They lace up like my ice skating boots when I was a kid - which is terrific! I'm sure they will be great for any and all purposes, but I am happy to have a boot that looks to me like a dress boot. I am thrilled with them!!
review.name: Gorgeous, elegant matte boots

review.reviewBody: I bought this pair of shoes and thought it would be so comfortable but instead it gave me two big blisters on both the inside part of my heal. They were so painful and i have emailed Sorel but no one care to reply to me. I always like the brand as the shoes normally very good. Not this style. My advise would be to avoid this shoes.
review.name: Huge disappointment with the shoes

review.reviewBody: Great light weight boot … if you wear thick socks size up!
review.name: All Season Boots

review.reviewBody: As most of the reviews state, these run unusually small and narrow. I went up 0.5 size and They were extremely small and uncomfortable. Checked for country of manufacture and not surprised to find them made in China, where shoes more often than not run small for western feet. Depending on how thick your socks you want to wear, you'd need to size up at least a whole size if not more to get enough room in the toe box. Such a shame as a good looking boot. Will be returning.
review.name: Wanted to love, but...

review.reviewBody:
They look like very comfortable Doc Martens and I was really excited! As I tried them on the first thing I noticed was the quality didn’t appear to live up to the normal Sorel standards. The stitching on the upper boot unraveled as I put them on and the toe box had a good sized dent that was permanent. 
I expect more Sorel- especially at this price point😞
review.name: Sad
comment: Hello Cindilynne1, we want to extend our sincerest apologies concerning this issue. We pride ourselves in maintaining the highest quality standards for our customers and apologize we missed the mark here.

review.reviewBody: The boots look good but definitely not what I was expecting quality wise. They already look quite scratched up. Kinda disappointed especially with the high price tag. They’re also quite uncomfortable…
review.name: Disappointed
comment: Hello NorthKat, we want to extend our sincerest apologies concerning this issue. We pride ourselves in maintaining the highest quality standards for our customers and apologize we missed the mark here.

review.reviewBody:
The photo for these brakes shows the regular lever and nothing in the description says anything about the short reach lever, but that's what I got. I'm not sure if Backcountry has regular and short reach ones and doesn't know the difference, or if these are all just mislabeled. To be clear the package that comes clearly calls out the lever type, it's just the website that has it wrong. 

These brakes are supposed to be awesome and if you have really small hands the short reach lever is probably great, but it's disappointing that they're not sending you what you think you're getting (not the first time I've run into this with Backcountry.)
review.name: Comes with short reach lever!

review.reviewBody: No where does it say these are the short lever versions nor does it give an option to choose them. But they are. Then charge return shipping for mislabeled product.
review.name: Wrong item

review.reviewBody:
The Cotopaxi Fuego Men’s Jacket is a standout choice for anyone looking for a reliable, stylish, and eco-conscious insulated jacket. Here’s a detailed breakdown of its performance:

Design & Style
The Fuego boasts a sleek and vibrant design, staying true to Cotopaxi's signature color-block aesthetic. It’s versatile enough to wear on outdoor adventures or in casual urban settings, making it both functional and fashionable. The fit is true to size, providing a tailored look without restricting movement.

Warmth & Comfort
Stuffed with responsibly sourced 800-fill hydrophobic goose down, the jacket offers exceptional warmth while remaining lightweight. It's ideal for chilly mornings and cold weather hikes, though it may not be sufficient for extreme winter conditions without layering. The elastic binding on the cuffs and hem keeps the cold air out and ensures a snug fit.

Durability & Build Quality
The ripstop nylon shell feels durable and resists tears and abrasions, making it perfect for outdoor activities. The DWR (Durable Water Repellent) finish offers decent protection against light rain and snow, though it’s not designed for heavy downpours.

Eco-Friendliness
Cotopaxi’s commitment to sustainability shines here. The down is RDS-certified, and the company uses recycled materials where possible. This aligns with their ethos of creating gear that’s as good for the planet as it is for the user.

Portability
The jacket packs down easily into the provided stuff sack, making it a great companion for travel or backpacking trips. It’s lightweight enough that you’ll barely notice it in your pack.

Price
While the Fuego is on the pricier side, its quality, performance, and sustainability make it a worthwhile investment. It’s a jacket that can last for years with proper care.

Final Thoughts
The Cotopaxi Fuego Men’s Jacket is an excellent choice for those seeking a blend of performance, style, and sustainability. Its vibrant design, superior warmth, and packability make it a go-to for outdoor enthusiasts and urban adventurers alike.

Rating: 4. 5/5
The only slight drawbacks are the lack of waterproofing for heavy rain and the premium price point. However, for most cold-weather scenarios, it’s a stellar pick.
review.name: A little detailed review of Cotopaxi Fuego Men's Jacket

Typical Size - men's small, women's medium. Purchased men'd small.

review.reviewBody: I am so glad I bought this chair and I absolutely loved having it on my 4 day 3 night backpacking trip.  I used it around camp and took it on my day hikes.  It's easy to set up, packs easily into it's own carrying case and is super light.  I won't backpack or day hike without it now!
review.name: Helinox Camp Chair is such a treat

review.reviewBody: I’m not an ultra lite freak, and 1 pound of weight is worth the comfort. I don’t know why I ever hiked without it. Game changer
review.name: Never leave home without it

review.reviewBody: Let's start with the good.  It is so small and so light that I can put it in my small shoulder bag.  It sets up and takes down easily with little to no learning curve.  It is quite comfortable, but I doubt someone very large would say that.  It's nice looking and breathes well when you are on it.  The downside is using it on sand or in other soft ground places.  I knew that so I also got the ground sheet specifically made for the zero chair.  (Backcountry does not sell it, so I got it direct from Helinox.)  I tried and tried but could not get the ground sheet on the chair legs.  I have had elbow surgery, so I figured it might be me.  I asked my 18 year old son to try and he could not get the ground sheet on the chair.  We both tried and came to the conclusion that the only way to get in on the legs would be to break them.  So, I will say that I will try again soon and update this review if I find a way to succeed.  But, my renew for now is that the chair is absolutely great, unless you want to use it on sand or soft ground.  Too bad, that.
review.name: Great little chair

review.reviewBody: NICE.  This chair is great.  Super lightweight and comfortable.  Needed a new chair as I previously had a Thermo-Rest'r chair I used for decades, but no longer worked when I graduated to an air sleeping pad.  Alas, I decided to splurge on a couple of these chairs for myself and my wife.  To me, this is the one 'must have' luxury item for backpacking.  Only has one issue that I have dealt with so far - it really prefers a flat, solid surface to sit on.  I've nearly fell out of the chair a couple times by either putting on a non-flat surface, or more frequently, punching one of the legs deep into the earth..
review.name: The Cadillac of Backpack chairs

review.reviewBody: Bought a pair of these for my wife and I. We hike and backpack a lot. These allow us to sit and take breaks. Rather than having to find rocks or logs to sit, we pop these up in just a few seconds. It allows us to rest our backs as well. We used them for the first time on a 25 mile day hike and now wonder why we did without them. I?m about 240 and almost 6 feet tall. I simply use my hiking poles to assist me up and it really works great.
review.name: Should have done this years ago

name: Chair Zero Camp Chair

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] In general, this is a good piece of carry-on luggage. It's a nice companion piece for the Ozone Carry-On Boarding Bag that I purchased previously and with which I've been satisfied. That said, there are a few shortcomings highlighted in other reviews that I would echo. First, a double pole handle (vs. the single pole) would provide more support for the companion bag when carrying the two together. With the single pole, the companion bag sometimes slides off the top of the carry on. Second, the addition shoulder straps would be useful in certain instances where travelers are handling multiple pieces of luggage. Third, four wheels rather than two would make the carry on more maneuverable when navigating through airports and the isles of airplanes. Finally, the computer sleeve integrated into this carry-on seems superfluous for travelers who are already carrying other briefcases or shoulder bags with computer sleeves included (such as the companion piece for this bag). Other than these points, the carry-on is a good product that lives up to expectations for any other Osprey bag that travelers might purchase.
review.name: In general, this is a

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] First flight with the new Ozone! Enjoyed the smooth wheels, laptop storage, overall capacity & build and the especially the metal handle for lifting into the overhead.
review.name: First flight with the new

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I like everything abt this carry on except for the wheels. I wish it had four wheels it makes such a difference be able to just push your bag along at the airport rather than being limited to pulling it behind you
review.name: I like everything abt this

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I’ve been very happy with my new Osprey Ozone Carry-On! I’ve used it traveling in Japan for several weeks, & am now using it in Mexico. It holds more than it would seem, & there are two compartments that can be used for sandals or snorkeling equipment or books. Also, there is a top zippered area for special items. The best thing is that it is clearly a carry/on - no challenges from airlines, some of which are setting smaller limits for carry/ons!
review.name: I’ve been very happy with

review.reviewBody:
The Ozone is in fact light and convenient. I have a previous model than the 2024 one, so things may be different with the newer one. I have used mine for a 4 week trip to SE Asia, 3 USA X country trips, a 2 week Italy trip, and multiple short trips to family and love the size, design and weight. But I have some comments:
My first comment is that the front (top) laptop pocket is not padded, and would not protect the laptop from damage. So pack it with its own padded case and/or be extra careful!
The second is that the interior packing straps are one sided - the female buckle side just barely comes up over the sides of the bag, which means they cannot be secured above the sides when packing and are always deep within the clothes in the bag when one goes to find and buckle them. It would be better if that end were on a longer strap, so they could be hung over the side of the bag - and stay there - while packing and the two buckles would then be buckled in the middle of the clothes, rather than the side.
The third is that the collapsing handle mechanism broke, and the handle only collapsed halfway, sticking up about a foot from the bag. This does not fit easily or compactly in the plane's overhead bin, earning me several annoyed looks from other passengers. I have sent it for repair.
The fourth is that there is no way to attach another bag to the top of this bag, without the top one falling to the side. I plan to buy some mini carabiners to attach the sides of my backpack to the sides of this bag to hold it steady.
review.name: Experienced traveler with comments

review.reviewBody: I was about to purchase this awesome carry on size roller osprey backpack when I noticed that it did not contain back pack shoulder straps! What a miss!!
review.name: Heavy traveler

review.reviewBody: I like the compact size and the light weight. The large wheels of this model will come in handy. The only annoying issue is the zippers are hard to open/close. Could use a bigger teeth zippers.
review.name: Light but could be better with zippers

review.reviewBody: I have purchased Osprey packs and wheeled backpacks. This very lightweight bag could be ideal if it were not collapsing on itself unopened. It's as though it was crushed. The stitching around the zippers is flawed so that the fabric designed to cover the zipper actually feeds into the mechanism causing it to jam. I really wanted to loved this zippy little carry on :persevere:. It's going back. It's it a one off? A miscreant? Or Osprey are you lowering your quality?
review.name: What's with these terrible zippers??!

review.reviewBody: Just bought version 2 of the Osprey Ozone 2 wheeled luggage. To my disappointment version 2 has gone up in price significantly but none of the zips are now lockable using travel locks unlike version 1 of this product.  This is a huge feature miss by Osprey especially since version 2 accommodates a laptop pocket. Seems like a backward step and downgrade vs the last version.  The zips on version 1 of this product were much sturdier and heavy duty and it seems their temptation to reduce the cost of the product got the better of them.
review.name: Really Osprey - Zip not lockable?

review.reviewBody: Teva, honestly I've always loved your products but it feels like you've sent shoes to every influencer in town lately and they promote a product with no knowledge, only out for that Freebie. For one, these shoes run Huge. I'm 6",1 always wear a size eleven and they literally fall off my feet in size 11 and size 10's. The 9's which exchanged the 11's for, fit snug, but my back heel was hanging out. So you're telling me you've built a shoe that is either slipping from your feet, or your buying a size to small to keep them on. I'll give the construction a quality comment because I'm not mad at the fabric. Just the fit, and everyone selling these with absolutely no direction about marketing from the company itself. Give these influencers Details about the products that actually matter rather than them walking through some outdoor scene which has been totally fabricated! If you need any help, please call anytime.
review.name: Stop Having Influencers Sell Your Products

review.reviewBody: I was skeptical but these are great. Perfect for wide foot. I will buy other colors.
review.name: Just got them. Perfect fit (width wise). Very comfy.

review.reviewBody: I love the burnt olive color of my slippers. I have worn them out for early NY September fall since I received them in the mail. They are so warm and comfortable and easy to wipe clean! I look forward to using them in the evenings of July and late August when camping. I am a size 8 in sandals so I ordered that size in these slippers, but they were too big. I exchanged them and the size 7 fit perfectly!
review.name: The most comfortable, warm, and easy to clean slides!

review.reviewBody: Hands down thee best kickin' around the house, yard, neighborhood, casual shoes! I've been a fan since they were the "Ember" and Teva has absolutely improved upon perfection! You won't be disappointed with these honeys right here! Go ahead, place the order!
review.name: Love, love, LOVE these shoes!!

review.reviewBody: I bought these. Unfortunately they are way wide for my feet. I wear medium width but these feel like they were designed for a wider mens foot or a very wide women's foot. Had to return.
review.name: Seems sized for men not women

review.reviewBody: After having a neuroma in my foot, the podiatrist recommended wearing indoor shoes for added support. I bought these and have never looked back. Easy to slip on and off, good grip, and it washes well with no change to shape or color. Have purchased multiple colors just in case these get discontinued but love these shoes!
review.name: Never stop making these!

review.reviewBody: They are a little narrower than I'd like but I'm hoping they will give a little over time. They are soft enough to give them a chance to break in. The length is good. My arches are high and my ball of my foot is wide. Not many make shoes I can even try to try. The color isn't my favorite but close enough, I'd like a more natural shade, hoping they'll fade a bit.
review.name: I think these might work

review.reviewBody: It was a great choice but the size was way too big‼️
review.name: I would buy again if I could get the size right!!

review.reviewBody: So comfortable, my plantar is out of control right now and these are like walking on a cloud!
review.name: I would love these in a different color

review.reviewBody: The shoes are very well made, comfortable and will last a long time. The biggest problem with the shoe is the back portion that is too short. The short back allows your foot to come out of the shoe. It's quite an odd design because it would be a great shoe with a higher back...
review.name: Undecided about the shoes

name: ReEMBER Terrain Slipper - Women's

hasVariant.name: Ducan Low GTX Hiking Shoe - Women's
hasVariant.description: Buy the Mammut Ducan Low GTX Hiking Shoe - Women's online or shop all Footwear from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Ducan Low GTX Hiking Shoe - Women's
hasVariant.description: Buy the Mammut Ducan Low GTX Hiking Shoe - Women's online or shop all Footwear from Backcountry.com.

review.itemreviewed: Ducan Low GTX Hiking Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody:
I like the shoe a lot! 

However,  I did have to return the original size 10 I normally wear, for a 9.5.  I could have probably sized down to a 9.  So the sizing is quite off, at least in my size range.  I normally like a little room so not to smash my toes, but the original size, there was a good 1.5-2” from my big toe to the front of the shoe.
review.name: Normal size didn’t work

review.itemreviewed: Ducan Low GTX Hiking Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: These shoes seem delightful to me!   I shopped and shopped on line to find a pair of waterproof hiking shoes.  These came yesterday and I love them.  True I have not had them on the trail, but I did send back several pairs before finding these gems.   I love their look, they are light,stylish and packable.  The way they lace allows you to make them larger or smaller and they fit me and are comfortable.  I wore them indoors all day yesterday.   I am happy.  Amy
review.name: Wonderful

review.itemreviewed: Ducan Low GTX Hiking Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: Shoe tongue comes high up and pushes against the foot with every step. Shoe tongue is not separate, like in most shoes, it's attached to the rest of the shoe material and impossible to reposition for better fit.  I have low volume feet; I assume it may fit differently with other foot shapes. Rest of the shoe is obviously well constructed and on a wider side.
review.name: Uncomfortable shoe tongue

name: Ducan Low GTX Hiking Shoe - Women's

description: Buy the Hydrapak Flux 1.0L Water Bottle online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Flux 1.0L Water Bottle
hasVariant.description: Buy the Hydrapak Flux 1.0L Water Bottle online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Flux 1.0L Water Bottle
hasVariant.description: Buy the Hydrapak Flux 1.0L Water Bottle online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: I  have several hydrapack products and this one is my favorite l. I’ve used this bottle on 3 separate 5 day hunts on the side of my pack and i  can’t say enough good things about it. It’s extremely rugged and durable and very very light. I will Be buying more without question
review.name: Phenomenal product is an understatement

review.reviewBody: Good bottle. Durable. Doesn't leak.  What I don't like is the air is sucked back into the bottle after you drink so it doesn't get smaller as you drink from it. It remains the original size taking up too much space in your pocket. I prefer the Stow bottles for this reason.
review.name: Doesn't shrink as you drink
comment:
Hi there!

The Flux has a more rigid design than the Stow which is why it retains its shape, however, it can be rolled up into the handle once empty. If you have any additional questions, please contact our CX team here:
https://hydrapak.com/pages/contact-us

Thanks!

review.reviewBody: I like how durable this bottle is, and how it rolls down for packing. It also stands up nicely on its own.
review.name: Durable bottle!

review.reviewBody: The Hydrapak Flux 1.0L water bottle kept us hydrated on multiple day hikes, but it had a strong initial smell that required several washes to fade. The flexible material retained flavor, which can be a pro or con. The snap cap is convenient, but handle it gently to prevent wear. Even in cold weather, it performed well. It's lightweight, packable, and a solid option.  They should add an option for a tube system for those looking to use it on backpacking multi day trips.
review.name: Packable Water Bottle - wash first

review.reviewBody: I use the bottle every day, both at work and on trips. It is very convenient to hold in the hand, when folded it takes up very little space. I wanted to complete the flask with a plug-n-play cap and a hydra flex tube, but unfortunately there is no place to buy them in Ukraine:((. The photo was taken in Ukraine, with Lake Nesamovyte in the background
review.name: Perfect flask

review.reviewBody: really excellent convenient and well made product.
review.name: great

review.reviewBody: Fantastic product with one major flaw - the plastic used by HydraPak makes the water taste terrible. I've never experienced this from any other bottle or reservoir to this degree. I hope it fades out over time. I've tried soaking it with lemon juice and baking soda and it still has the foul taste. Otherwise, I think this bottle is incredible.
review.name: Awesome bottle but the water tastes funny!

review.reviewBody: It's great - packs small, great for watersports and nice for the sauna where metal bottles would get too hot. The lid id a bit tricky, I also bought the straw lid but it's seems to leak with this bottle.
review.name: Great replacement for plastic

name: Flux 1.0L Water Bottle

review.reviewBody: It is what it is supposed to be, a large pannier that fits a lot of stuff. I use it everyday even when I'm not biking. Nice rugged material on the main body.  I was a little disappointed that it didn't have the mesh on the draw string panel, instead it had sort of a nylon liner type material. The mesh would have been nice for airing out sweaty work boots and clothes but the nylon is decent at keeping water out.
review.name: Straight forward big no pockets side bag

name: Local Grocery 16L Pannier Bag

description: Buy the Sweaty Betty Power Workout Dress - Women's online or shop all Clothing from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Power Workout Dress - Women's
hasVariant.description: Buy the Sweaty Betty Power Workout Dress - Women's online or shop all Clothing from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Perfect for my niece to go running in. She loves the pockets in the skirt
review.name: Great

review.reviewBody: Does the job, although the shorts do ride up for me. Other than that looks good and is comfortable.
review.name: Good for tennis

review.reviewBody: As other reviewers have said, you need to wiggle a bit to get into it, but this is a fabulous gym dress
review.name: Love it

review.reviewBody: Bought this dress to actually play tennis in. Didn’t quite appreciate how difficult it is to get on as you have to pull it up over your shoulders. Has to buy a size up to get it on but a bit baggy on the top once on.
review.name: Great once it is on

review.reviewBody: The material is soft and comfy, but sweaty betty’s sizing for the larger sizes leaves something to be desired. Almost too tight around the thighs but soo baggy and loose around the midriff and bust section. Avoid if you are heavier in your legs.
review.name: Weird sizing/fit dress

review.reviewBody: I was really excited for these dresses arriving, how disappointed was I. Whilst the style and quality looked great when I opened them, that’s unfortunately as far as I got! I could not get the thing on! It’s a racer back and you step through the neck opening. I am well endowed and could not get it barely past my bust and getting my arms and shoulders in just wasn’t possible! No stretch at all lt felt like if I tried any further I’d need cutting back out!!! I even looked online for a guide on how to put it on thinking it was just me!!!!
review.name: Tennis dress impossible to get on

review.reviewBody: Power Gym Dress is fantastic. The small is a perfect fit, I vary between small-medium. The shorts are comfortable and the dress length is not too short, coming to just below the shorts. I’m 5ft 4in. I plan on wearing it on walks, hikes, workouts. I will buy it again!
review.name: Fabulous sporty dress

review.reviewBody: Honestly one of the cutest and most flattering summer dresses I have ever tried on. Would be great for tennis or even running or yoga. My issue was twofold - one, the obvious problem of having to remove the entire dress to use the loo, which is a bit inconvenient if you're at home or a nice gym and very inconvenient if you're somewhere without nice facilities. Second, having to remove the entire dress down from the smallest part of the body to the widest part of the body so frequently made me worry about stretch through the neck of the dress. It honestly fit so well I couldn't believe it, especially through the bust, but I had to return it. I wonder if just connecting the shorts to the back half of the dress at the waist would at least help with putting it on without stretching. Really nice but not quite there.
review.name: Cute but not practical
comment:
Hi there,

A massive thank you for taking time out of your day to leave us feedback.

We’re so sorry to hear that our Power Gym Dress didn’t fit as you’d hoped. We’re listening, learning and constantly striving to be better. We will make sure to pass this onto the relevant team.

Should you require any further assistance, our Customer Care Team would be more than happy to help.

Best wishes,
Team SB

review.reviewBody:
Absolutely fantastic outfit for my Astanga practice. Looks beautiful and fit like a glove. 
I believe these dresses are the future. 
Thank you.
review.name: The best yoga outfit

review.reviewBody: The Power Gym Dress is an absolute MUST for your wardrobe.  I normally wear SB S leggings but go up a size to a SB M for tops so was a bit unsure on the sizing, but I am happy to report that the small fits like an absolute glove. This dress fits and sucks you in, in all the right places, supports the boobs well, looks incredibly flattering and is practical with its two pockets. The undershorts are brilliant to prevent summer chub rub. As soon as I wore it, I received many compliments. It is a multifunctional, versatile dress that can be worn for any sporting activity and looks sleek enough that it can be work for nights out in the evenings. I would buy this in every colour if I could.
review.name: Power Gym Dress is a perfect fit

name: Power Workout Dress - Women's

description: Buy the Saucony Triumph 22 Running Shoe - Men's online or shop all Footwear from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Triumph 22 Running Shoe - Men's
hasVariant.description: Buy the Saucony Triumph 22 Running Shoe - Men's online or shop all Footwear from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Great shoes as always.  You never disappoint. I don't buy any other shoes.
review.name: JUST ALL AND ALL HIGHLY RECOMMENDED

review.reviewBody: Too much volume in the upper and it folds over. Got a few hot spots in the base of big toe
review.name: Pretty good

review.reviewBody: Excellent cushioned shoe. I am on my second pair this year. I logged 80 miles on my first pair (still going) Wanted to get another pair as backup.
review.name: Strongest recommendation

review.reviewBody: I bought these shoes for my son and he loves them.
review.name: Great shoes but terrible delivery

review.reviewBody:
I couldn’t wait to purchase these immediately after putting 300 miles on my Triumph 21s, which were among my favorite everyday running shoes of all time. 

Unfortunately, everywhere the 21 went right, the 22 went wrong. What was originally a light, reactive, responsive shoe became a bulky, over-stacked, stiff replacement. Just 50 miles in, and injuries that I have never experienced are now creeping in, rendering me unable to keep using these. I had such high hopes after such a positive experience with the Triumph 21, but these were a huge step back.
review.name: Big step back from the Triumph 21

review.reviewBody: I purchased the Triumph last month in my local running store. I am literally a runner of 45 years w/out interruption. I have been running in Hoka for 8 years. I always have 4 fresh pairs of shoes to alternate. The Hoka's caused severe pain on my right foot toes over the last 6 months. Horrible pain but I kept running. I now have 3 Triumph's and a Hurricane which is great. Better cushion, quality and more stability than Hoka's. I ran in a Saucony for my Sub3 marathon years ago. I am back with this iconic brand. Ty!
review.name: Life Saver

review.reviewBody: Just purchased these shoes. Excellent fit. True to size. Comfortable.
review.name: Returning to Saucony from Hoka

review.reviewBody:
Super comfortable. 
I am prone to achilles issues, and when it's flaring up this shoe can be the only shoe I have that works. Roomy, soft and plush.
review.name: Plush and cozy ride for eating up everyday miles

review.reviewBody: I like the cushioning, but still does not feel like walking/ jogging on a marshmallow. The claimed “spring” rigs true for me. I love these shoes and will return to the sole that they now advertise.
review.name: Cushing with bounce.
comment: Thanks for the awesome 5-stars!

review.reviewBody: I am not a runner but I am on my feet all day and on concrete. I have tried several of the top of the line running shoes. so far the triumph 22 is by for the most comfortable.i have already bought a second pair.
review.name: top notch

name: Triumph 22 Running Shoe - Men's

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This is a fantastic jacket for the price.  It's extremely lightweight.  That makes it very versatile, it can keep my little one dry when the weather is warmer or be layered over a warm layer if it's a little cooler.  It packs down to nearly nothing, so it's very easy to pack when travelling, or to stuff in her backpack when rain is expected later in the day.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I like dressing my kiddo in bright colors, especially for all of the outdoor activities we do! This jacket is great for misty or drizzling rain and it's not too heavy for FL. I sized up for her to grow into and layer easily. She loves it!
review.name: Perfectly light!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Nice lightweight jacket. The jacket fits well and is comfortable.

review.reviewBody:
[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This jacket is awesome! It is very lightweight, very comfortable. We are from Costa Rica and we get lots of rain during the year. This jacket is for my daughter and it does what we wanted: protect her from the rain. 
My daughter packs the jacket easily in her backpack and it saves the day!

review.reviewBody: I've had these boots for about 6 weeks and I'm very pleased.  The grip is strong, a lot of my recent hikes have been steep and I appreciated the tread on these boots, they didn't let me down!  The fit is good too, no toe bumping on the front of the boot on the way down.
review.name: I'd buy them again

review.reviewBody:
I purchased these (winter) boots along with my summer hiking shoes.   They both fit perfectly.  Even though these claim they are size 8.5, (which I have always worn and thought to be a 39.  I wanted to try a longer size (at age 70, i realized that my foot had lengthened).    I tried the size 9, but they were too big (long), as my heal was lifting.  I decided to go back to the 8.5, which actually are 40.5 (not the 39 that I was use to).  They are slender looking, yet have enough width.  
I was thrilled that, if the shoe/boot is either the wong size/fit, Backcountry would reimbure or exchange them.   I could not be more happy.   

I will be back to BC for more !
review.name: Hiking Boot and Hiking shoe

review.reviewBody: I've worn Asolo Styngers for years and loved them.  I hoped that these boots would be a suitable replacement.  But while test-walking on a carpeted floor,  I felt rubbing on the top of my foot near my toes which never happened with my Styngers.  This would be problematic on longer hikes.  Sadly, I returned them.  Will probably buy another pair of Styngers.  As info, I have a wide forefoot, high arch and narrow heel.  Perhaps other feet won't have the same problem.
review.name: Rubbing on the top of my foot

name: Finder GV Hiking Boot - Women's

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] The father reports that the pack is wonderfully comfortable and easy to use. Baby seems happy with it too.
review.name: The father reports that the

review.reviewBody: Very easy to use! This carrier has lots of room for both your child and your extra snacks! I was able to fit my very large for his age 3 year old comfortably as well as carry my 7 month old for 5 hours without any issues. If you are considering the standard poco and the plus model definitely upgrade to the plus. The additional storage compartment gives this bag a lot more versatility without adding bulk or very much weight. I am 6’3” 180lbs and this bag could be adjusted to my size easily. I had enough adjustment in the waist strap to allow for 2 of me to fit side by side, so it’s safe to say this bag should be suitable for just about anyone. I researched carriers like this for a while and having picked this one I am confident this offers the best balance of premium quality without added expense for the brand name alone.
review.name: Comfortable and lighter than expected.

review.reviewBody: I've used this pack on a few hikes now in the adk and absolutely loved it! My kid stays comfortable and loves riding around in it. On my most recent hike I slipped pretty good but this pack left me with the maneuverability to spin and catch myself and keep the kiddo safe! I definitely recommend this pack to everyone!
review.name: Great pack all the way around

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Backpack is very comfortable and well made. Used it for the first time this weekend with our 1 year old and she loved it on a 1hr hike.
review.name: Backpack is very comfortable and

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Very comfortable and the mesh back is very breathable. Overall a great pack for getting little ones into nature.
review.name: Very comfortable and the mesh

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] The kiddos love the backpack and it's supper comfortable for me to wear. Easy to adjuster if anyone need to take break from carrying the kids. Pockets have plenty of space.
review.name: The kiddos love the backpack

review.reviewBody: I ordered this pack online, confident that it would fit as we’ve been devout Osprey pack owners for 15 years. Unfortunately, the handle presses into the back of our neck (5’5” and 6.0” height), making it very uncomfortable to look straight or up. So basically, you have to tilt your head down in an unnatural position while wearing. Even the photo of the model wearing the pack is standing awkwardly (you can see the handle against her head in the photo). Everything else about the pack is excellent, so we’re very disappointed.
review.name: Handle presses into back of head

review.reviewBody: I’m 5’0, 105 lbs and so surprised how comfortable this pack is while carrying my chubby nephew on the trail. The pocket is large enough to carry multiple snacks and other clothing materials! I recommend.
review.name: Perfect for my Chubby Nephew

review.reviewBody: It is worth the extra cost to get this. We hardly used our other hiking backpack because it was so uncomfortable. This Osprey Poco has been amazing! It's lightweight, easy to use, and very adjustable. We got a great deal from Backcountry. Shipping was fast and packaged securely
review.name: The best hiking backpack on the market!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Such A great backpack for carrying kids. It seems every detail has been thought of an incorporated into this. Of course, I would expect such from Osprey! Great quality, and a great build.
review.name: Such A great backpack for

review.reviewBody: Quality apparel and outdoor gear for your adventures!! 😃

review.reviewBody: Bought for the hubby and he's very happy with it. Great for someone who always travels. Perfect alternative to jeans.

review.reviewBody: I bought these for my boyfriend but they didn’t fit. The butt & crotch was oddly large & the legs not quite long enough.
review.name: Poor fit

review.reviewBody: Excellent fit and very comfortable material. Perfect blend of tailored and casualness.
review.name: Super comfortable

review.reviewBody:
The quality of material and design are excellent. However it is a bit bigger than usual L size I get from other brands (both on length and width). 
I suggest buy one size down.
review.name: Excellent material, but runs a bit big them expected

review.reviewBody:
One of my favorite pairs of pants.
Fit, cut, fabric, design, durability, comfort, colors (I have several pair).
Whether it be at work, at home, outdoors (summer and winter - with room for insulating layers), relaxing.
I tried on and bought my first pair in-store in Seattle, now ordering them online (living remotely in Finland)
review.name: No stopping the Ripstop

review.reviewBody: I’m size 32-33 in pants and medium in Patagonia size pants, I ordered medium ripstops and everything is good except for the butt, you can literally fit 2 of my butts in there lol. Sending them back to exchange for small.
review.name: Pants are good but run really big in the back.

review.reviewBody: Most comfortable pant I own! I bought my first pair onsale heading into summer, and wore them relentlessly. Come fall and I had to buy a 2nd pair. I even paid full price…they are worth it! Pockets are perfect, great quality, no fuss. I move a lot, walking, hiking, climbing, and the pants just move with me. My only wish is that they had a side loop for my carabiner/car keys.
review.name: Favorite Pants!

review.reviewBody: my grandson loved it, its already been to the snow!
review.name: yes

review.reviewBody: Jacket is so great and very functional that I'm actually on my second one.
review.name: A+

review.reviewBody: Love my light weight jacket. Its like my wife's version of a light sweater, I always have it with me just in case of a downpour or AC too high in businesses & restaurants.
review.name: I would buy this again.

review.reviewBody: This is a great piece of rain gear essential when shooting outside in the rain with filming and also a great piece of clothing cause it keeps you warm from the elements and dry. Would recommend this to anyone on a film crew. Working in the elements.
review.name: Would recommend this to anybody on a film crew

review.reviewBody: Great looking jacket that has outstanding wind-blocking and rain shedding ability. My wife likes it since it doesn't readily show dirt.
review.name: Good All-around Jacket

review.reviewBody: I bought a replacement Antora jacket under a warranty claim. I've had my previous Antora jacket for about 2 years and really liked it. I put it to the test in August by wearing it in Iceland's super windy and rainy conditions and it held up pretty well, except on the days where it was pouring rain, I could start to feel the cold and dampness through the jacket. It doesn't seem to repel the rain as well compared to the rain jacket (different brand) that my travel companion was wearing. Also, the heat transfer logo on the front and back were starting to peel off, which is disappointing. Overall, still a very good jacket for everyday use.
review.name: Really like this jacket except for a couple of things

review.reviewBody: This was a replacement for an older NF jacket that lasted years. The size I got is medium and it is a true fit, hangs properly, arm lengths just right and not too tight. I use this jacket as a shell with a fleece when I need warm wind and rain protection.A great jacket on a windy day or just a light chill. I hike regularly and this is always with me.
review.name: Great jacket

review.reviewBody: The North Face Men's Antora Jacket is an outstanding piece of outerwear that blends style, performance, and protection. From the first wear, I could tell this jacket was built for both durability and comfort. The waterproof, breathable fabric keeps me dry during rainy weather while allowing for ventilation so I don't overheat, making it ideal for all types of outdoor activities, from hiking to city strolls. The fit is spot-on-tailored enough to provide a sleek look without sacrificing mobility. The adjustable hood is a great feature, offering full protection from the elements while still being snug enough to wear comfortably. The elastic cuffs and adjustable hem ensure a perfect fit and keep the cold out, while the zippered pockets offer ample space to store essentials like my phone, keys, and gloves. What I love most about the Antora Jacket is its versatility. Whether I'm layering it over a fleece for a winter hike or wearing it on its own for a rainy day, it provides the right amount of warmth and protection. Plus, the modern design and subtle North Face branding give it a sleek, minimalist look that works for both outdoor adventures and everyday use. Overall, the North Face Men's Antora Jacket is a top-tier jacket that delivers on all fronts: weather resistance, comfort, and style. It's an excellent investment for anyone in need of reliable, high-performance outerwear. Highly recommended!
review.name: The Perfect Jacket for All-Weather Protection and Comfort!

review.reviewBody: This new model is better than the previous model, except that it no longer has the parts you can unzip under your arms.
review.name: This product is well worth the money

review.reviewBody: This jacket was a medium and it fit perfectly. I am 155lbs and 5'9 . There was room for reach, is the perfect shell in wind or rain. It is my go to outer layer. Great color blue as well!
review.name: If you are a hiker it is a great shell

review.reviewBody: I love the combination of the 3 different size tech bags. A great small carry bag (sling or waist) when combined with the carry strap. I also love the ability to add them to my PRVKE Lite for additional space and an easy to access pouch when traveling.
review.name: Combo

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Love how much I can put in there, and stylish too. definitely recommend.
review.name: perfect sidekick

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I buy too many WANDRD products in diff colors to use on days according to my mood. And also to color code what is stored where, and I use these small tech bags for chargersso I have diff colors for macbook vs windows laptops, and is easy to grab at a glance.
review.name: Great little bag

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] The perfect way to keep my camera and laptop accessories organized and stored. All my cords, charging blocks, mouse and stylus fit with plenty of room left.
review.name: Awesome storage!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Love the bag, both as EDC and tech pouch. Materials are great.
review.name: Great materials and functionality!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] The Tech Bag is a really great add-on to my PRVKE 31, as it allowed not just extra storage, but also a separate compartment to organize/prioritize items that I want to get to quicker without having to fumble in the larger compartments. It seems very secure when clipped onto the backpack, which is good for obvious reasons. It does, however, get in the way a bit when trying to quickly and smoothly unzipping the front backpack pocket. It's also rather time-consuming trying to remove it from the backpack to use it solo with the carrying strap due the secureness. This made the Carry Strap somewhat of an unnecessary purchase for me, as I am reluctant to spend time taking off the tech bag vs. just using a separate fanny pack for the lighter-need occasions.
review.name: Great Add-On to the PRVKE

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I bought the tech bag as a daily-use tech pouch that stores my work essentials (chargers, wireless headphones, wireless mouse, usb adaptors, etc.). The medium size works best for me since I carry a 20L bag to work and I needed something to fit inside that without taking too much space. The materials WANDRD uses and the form factor of the pouch feel so good that I like holding it my hand more than keeping it in my bag!I would definitely recommend this pouch! And the only feedback I have is if there was a way to have the internal dividers be removable (or attached via velcro pull tabs) as they tend to get in the way when one is trying to fit multiple things. Other than that.. this is one heck of a well built pouch with premium materials!
review.name: One of the best built tech bags out there!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] It's roomy, holds all my miscellaneous tech stuff with plenty of subdivisions
review.name: Great bag

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Perfect for on the go photography! Especially, when traveling! We love this!
review.name: Tech Bag Review

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I use this bag daily and love it! I use the carry strap so it is a cross body bag. Fits everything I need and more. I had to get the new Makalu Grey color!
review.name: Cross body bag

description: Buy the LEKI Wanderfreund Makalu Trekking Pole online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Wanderfreund Makalu Trekking Pole
hasVariant.description: Buy the LEKI Wanderfreund Makalu Trekking Pole online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: For walking with a broken foot and rehab this product can’t be beat in my opinion.  I’ve had one for 4 years and just bought a second one.   Comparing the quality to Kopperdell for instance the pole and tip are larger and stronger as are the extension adjusters.   Excellent for me
review.name: My top pick

review.reviewBody: I have used this walking stick as a daily cane for the last 2 months and have had no problems at all. I have used it on everything from steep hikes to just getting around town and have had no problems the other reviews have mentioned. It has not collapsed on me and I have fully relied on it for support while using stairs and to help take the load off my healing leg. Would absolutely recommend, especially for travel where it is easy to store away.
review.name: Fantastic Product

review.reviewBody: I've owned the LEKI Wanderfreund Antishock Dss Trekking Pole since April 8, 2017 with no issues whatsoever, and yet I've had this Leki Wanderfreund Makalu for less than a month with over two dozen times this pole giving out. Please do not buy this hazardous product unless you want to use it for something other than walking or hiking (perfectly suitable to carry it around for cosplay as a pretend hiker as it's certainly pretty and looks the part). During the course of normal use, the bottom of the pole must contact the ground for such a pole to assist in walking or hiking whatsoever. When this pole contacts the ground, the two points of adjustment are unable to be secured sufficiently to prevent collapse of the pole meaning the support the pole is intended to provide for stability while in motion cannot be relied upon (or may only be relied upon if one doesn't value their life to fall over at the wrong time along one's path when it gives out). The old LEKI used a twist-to-secure mechanism for each of the two adjustable length rod sections of the pole. The new Leki uses two secure-in-place plastic-and-metal toggles. There is an adjustment on this newer version with gnurling that does not appear to do anything to improve this. I've attempted to upload my video to this review to illustrate the problems, showing how the pole is intended to be secured and how easily it loosens by simply tapping lightly on the ground.
review.name: Do Not Rely on For Stability or Support - Cosplay Suitable Only

name: Wanderfreund Makalu Trekking Pole

review.reviewBody: These are great! Had a pair years ago, they were good but I think these are better. I keep them in the back of my WW kayak for portages, or just putting on to walk to the car at takeout. Great fit, and the soles are really grippy when carrying my boat on uneven ground.
review.name: Great sandals for water sports!

review.reviewBody: Used for casual wear,love the comfort of these sandals,no complaints!!!
review.name: Comfortable

review.reviewBody: I've had four ankle surgeries for failed PTT, including one for bone fusion, and cannot even go barefoot to shower. Teva contoured sandals are safer than flips, more stable, and the heel strap keeps me from walking out of them (HATE slides & thongs) In the 1980s-90s I would have worn them whitewater canoeing, kayaking, sailing, and at the beach. Now I'm an ambulatory wheelchair user.
review.name: Third pair of supportive water sandals

review.reviewBody: The Hydratrek sandals are top notch. Both the fit and finish are excellent! I highly recommend them to anyone who's looking for a comfortable pair of sandals. They're well built and worth every penny!
review.name: Very nice sandals!

review.reviewBody: Use my sandals typically on fishing outings. My feet are quite often wet, but the shoe withstands the constant wet very well and dry out quickly. The sole both inner and outer are not slippery when wet. Great sandal for wet or damp situations.
review.name: Great sandal for wet conditions

review.reviewBody: After wearing them to the lake and drying outside, they curled up and shrank in the sun. Teva says this is outlined in the warranty, but where is that information when you are buying? Teva refused to replace them. Not cool, Teva. Onward to a better brand.
review.name: Shrink in the sun

review.reviewBody: These feel great, right out of the box! They're light, but seem to be very well made. I'd highly recommend them for the beach!
review.name: Nice and Comfortable

review.reviewBody: I love the way they form to my feet and nothing rubs and causes pain. They are a great fit and the straps are nice and sturdy. The reason I gave it four starts instead of five is that they tend to turn the bottom of my feet a little black in some areas. Hopefully that will change over time but I've worn these quite a few times and for long periods of time, even around water. I love that you can wear them around water! I'd still buy these sandals again!
review.name: I would definitely but these sandals again! Super comfy!

review.reviewBody: I am using my Tevas for light hiking and water sports (jet ski riding). The Hydratrek sounded perfect, but it is missing one key thing other styles have - it does not have padding under the strap that goes across the top of the foot and it caused irritation when wet. The Teva Terra FI 5 Universal Hiking Sandal does have that wetsuit-like padding under the strap so it is much more comfortable when wearing them wet. I went with that one instead.
review.name: Missing one thing other styles have

review.reviewBody: I love these sandals... The fit is so comfortable, and you feel confident walking in them as your feet are locked in. I actually bought another pair after the first because I want to have a back up. Got two pair for my wife as well.
review.name: Not sure I waited till now to buy a pair

name: Hydratrek Sandal - Men's

review.reviewBody: I am totally satisfied with the items quality and the speed of delivery. I can recommend this brand to everyone! My child loves it as well.
review.name: Perfect purchase

review.reviewBody:
My kids all wear Reima snowsuits. They're so warm, they stay dry, they're easy to put on, and the kids can move around in them very well outside. They aren't too bulky or heavy. 
They do fit a little large, but with elastic wrists and ankles, they fit fine even though they're a little big, and you can get two seasons out of one suit. I bought a 12-18 month suit for my infant to wear next year, and just for fun my 2 year old tried it on and it fit. So my infant will hopefully get 2 winters out of it!
review.name: Love Reima Suits

review.reviewBody: Bright, happy colors for a two year old! Lots of room to grow into for next winter. Looks very cozy!
review.name: Bright, happy colors for a

review.reviewBody: Nice and warm snowsuit, thin enough that my 1 yo actually moves around in it, doesn't bulk up like others we've had in the past. Don't size up.
review.name: Warm snowsuit that isn't bulky

review.reviewBody: Keeps my little one dry playing in the snow. Great quality.
Nice quality and color, size is bit bigger, overall good looking snowsuit. My daughter is in love
review.name: Nice quality and color, size

review.reviewBody: Great snowsuit! What I love about it suits that you can put no layers when it’s not that cold… adding layers as getting colder… with rainy boots and no worries for mom when child finds water puddles. If you want your child be warm in the winter time this brand knows everything about cold ! It’s our second suit and I can’t imagine buying anything else but reima brand. review.itemreviewed: Kaha 2 Low GTX Hiking Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: I've been wearing HOKAs for 3 years now and have settled on Bondi 8. Basically that's all I wear all the time due to a heel spur and HOKA Bondi 8 saved my life. But in very wet conditions for golf they are terrible. No grip and soaked. I was excited for the KAHA 2 low GTX since they said Plush and waterproof. They are very waterproof - played two rounds in very wet weather and my feet were DRY. They have great grip in muddy, sloppy, wet turf. But they are NOT plush (at least like the Bondi 7 or Bondi 8). To me they dont feel that different from regular waterproof golf shoes honestly. And they are a little stiff - at least at first. Lastly, they are bigger than the Bondi 8 fit-wise. Perhaps to accomodate for thicker socks usually worn for hiking or trail running. Sure wish they made a GTX version of the Bondi 8.
review.name: Waterproof but not cushioned

review.itemreviewed: Kaha 2 Low GTX Hiking Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: These shoes fit closer to true size. I've had a few pairs of Hokas and the running shoes seem to run small to size. This particular shoe feels pretty good, but after being in them for a couple of hours I noticed the outside of my feet hurting. There seems to be a lump, for lack of a better word, on the insole. I will continue to where these shoes as needed but will be paying close attention to that particular part of the shoe.
review.name: Solid Shoe....But

review.itemreviewed: Kaha 2 Low GTX Hiking Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: Everyday walking. Sole is not comfortable and size is too small.
review.name: I would Not buy this product again.

review.itemreviewed: Kaha 2 Low GTX Hiking Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: I had no issues. These shoes are great for hiking walking trails great grip
review.name: Great Hiking Shoes

review.itemreviewed: Kaha 2 Low GTX Hiking Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: Not nearly as comfortable as my other Hokas. It does not lace up well; it is hard to tighten on the lower portion of the foot. It is the correct size - same as my other Hokas - but seems loose side-to-side, which I attribute to the lacing issue.
review.name: OKAY BUT NOT GREAT

review.itemreviewed: Kaha 2 Low GTX Hiking Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: This shoe seems to have more room in the toe area, which is nice. As a caddie, these have kept my feet dry the three times I was out caddying in the morning dew. The laces are weak, their fat and come untied easily. Once again I had to replace them with Lock Laces.
review.name: I decent walking shoe

review.itemreviewed: Kaha 2 Low GTX Hiking Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: I hesitated because of the price tag but after buying them, the best money I've ever spent on shoes.
review.name: Great shoes

review.itemreviewed: Kaha 2 Low GTX Hiking Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: Love the style, the feel, the stability,and the durability. I'm just not crazy about this color.
review.name: Love these shoes!!!

review.itemreviewed: Kaha 2 Low GTX Hiking Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: I love these shoes! My toes are sensitive and I hate when shoes cramp my toes together. These shoes have a wide toe area, perfect for my feet. Try them out! If you don't like them you can return them for free. I bet you'll love them too.
review.name: Great shoe!!

review.itemreviewed: Kaha 2 Low GTX Hiking Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: I decided to purchase these shoes for hiking after wearing another brand for the last 5 years. I wear a 12 but all the reviews said they run large so I ordered a 11.5. I wore them walking a few times to break them in and they felt fine. I recently returned home from backpacking 5 days in Wyoming and 3 days of summiting 14er's in Colorado. The shoes were great as I put them through all types of terrain and weather. The hubble heel with the swallowtail provided great stability on the ankles for a lowcut shoe. The cushioning helped absorb all the impact walking, climbing, and especially descending on rocks. My knees thank you. The gtx waterproofing worked as it should in the light rain we encountered and in the 2-3 inches of unexpected snow that dumped on us. My socks were completely dry (with rain pants) after 12 miles in fresh and melted snow. I was the only one with dry feet! The flaw. I usually get a blister on a heel or sometimes both while backpacking for days but this time I got it in a new spot. I was relieved that I didn't get it in the same spot on the heel/achilles area because it becomes somewhat painful to hike with over time. After 10 miles on day 1 a blister started up on the inside of both feet between my heels and arches. Ive never had a blister in this spot before. I inspected the inside of the shoes and found that there is a hard piece of material under the mesh lining that wraps around the back of the shoe where the bird and Hoka logo are printed. Inside the shoe, the lip of the hard material protrudes and rubs right where my blisters formed even through my stance socks. I threw some KT tape over them to help diminish the rubbing for the remainder of the trip. I now have one very large fluid filled blister, because the other popped, that I am currently attending too. Besides this flaw, which can be fixable, the shoe held up great as i put just over 70 miles on them. If I didnt get blisters in this odd spot, I would give a 5 star
review.name: Great hiking shoe, with one major flaw

name: Kaha 2 Low GTX Hiking Shoe - Men's

review.reviewBody: This worked perfectly as a direct replacement for my original stripped out bolt & tension knob. I like the built in clutch so I can’t over tighten. Could have been less expensive, but I think the old trainer has lots of life left so it was worth it.

review.reviewBody: This works just fine, until it doesn’t. This is the third one I’ve had to buy because the other two just quit functioning.

review.reviewBody: After 3 years of consistent use, my trainer knob on my M2 trainer broke. This replacement kit came with all of the necessary pieces & was easy to install. I am looking forward to many more years of riding on my trainer!

review.reviewBody: I wish I could give this more stars.   I have had to get two of these replacement knobs over the years because the plastic tends to fail over time.   The initial knob used to require about 3 full revolutions to go from first contact to the click (tight enough).  The first replacement knob took 3 full revs.  This latest knob will go all the way to 5 revs or further and completely squishes the tire - clearly over tightening.  I cannot rely on the torque-break I have to count revs.
review.name: Propensity to over-tighten

review.reviewBody: My old knob must have lost it's lube and hard twisting (three full turns after contacting the wheel) was getting harder and harder, until it stripped.  This clicker knob, that came lubed, is really great!

review.itemreviewed: NewRun BUGrip GTX Running Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: Took these shoes out for a 15-miler in the snow/ice and they did everything I wanted and more! The BOA system makes it super easy to adjust feeling locked in when it gets icier. The spikes on the bottom provided great traction on icy parts. The GORETEX did what it does best at keeping moisture out while allowing my feet to breathe. Fit-wise, the toe box is roomy which is important to me in any running shoe. My heels also felt locked in and secure. Overall I'm very happy with the product and would recommend it to anyone looking for a reliable winter running shoe.
review.name: BOA, Spikes, and GTX

review.itemreviewed: NewRun BUGrip GTX Running Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody:
We live in the mountains and run outside year round. My previous Icebugs (Anima) have been great for many years. The insoles were getting a bit stiff, so thought I'd replace with the NewRuns. 
Pros: 
- warm!
- roomy toebox as others have mentioned

Cons: 
- not enough tread to complement the studs. When running in snow, I actually slipped around because studs weren't enough to deal with a snow layer on the surface. I never slipped in the Animas, which had decent, road friendly, 5mmish lugs. These don't have sufficient lugs.
- BOA lacing feels poorly executed on this shoe. Couldn't get the shoe tight around the ankle, which isn't helpful when you're slipping around in the first place. 
- Pretty firm midsole material (though you may not view this as a con)
review.name: Wanted to love em, ended up disappointed

review.itemreviewed: NewRun BUGrip GTX Running Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody:
These are great. Just what I hoped for. Grip on ice (even black ice), packed snow, and pavement is solid. I don't have to slow down because I'm worried about the surface or can't really see the surface, because they grip all winter surfaces. They do make noise on pavement but I got used to that. 
I normally wear women's 11 and the men's 9.5 fit.  The IceBug NewRun has more room for my toes compared to the Icebug Rover, so I'm keeping the NewRun.
If you run in ice & snow, you will love these.
review.name: Love them!

name: NewRun BUGrip GTX Running Shoe - Men's
