review.itemreviewed: Merino 150 Tech Lite Polar Paddle T-Shirt - Men's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This is a high quality garment that lives up to the price tag. It stays fresh even after a few wears and is perfect for travel. It does attract a lot of lint but the comfort and utility of this shirt outweighs that for me.
review.name: Thank you Sheep!

review.itemreviewed: Merino 150 Tech Lite Polar Paddle T-Shirt - Men's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I buy this for my son- it's his favorite shirt. I buy one every year and it's his favorite gift. He wears it almost every day for work!
review.name: I would buy this product again and again and again!

review.itemreviewed: Merino 150 Tech Lite Polar Paddle T-Shirt - Men's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I love these shirts but sadly the consistency of the sizes was off, I received two smalls and one was significantly wider than the other. they also run long past the waist so I need to get them altered
review.name: Great shirt

review.itemreviewed: Merino 150 Tech Lite Polar Paddle T-Shirt - Men's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This has been my go to shirt for everything from hanging out at home to walking, hiking and every kind of outdoor activity. A perfect blend of breathability, durability and warmth. Great value!
review.name: Perfect shirt for every activity

review.itemreviewed: Merino 150 Tech Lite Polar Paddle T-Shirt - Men's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] We bought these in men's & women's for a 3 week trekking adventure. These shirts are awesome. You can easily rinse to freshen up when you have access to running water, they dry quickly and don't hold any funky smell, perfect for travel. We took 2 for each of us, so that one could be rinsed/dried and the other worn. Excellent purchase & worth the price. Weight is heavy enough to wear like a regular T (vs undershirt) but light enough to keep you cool on warm days & dry quickly when washed. Highly recommend.
review.name: Best T

review.itemreviewed: Merino 150 Tech Lite Polar Paddle T-Shirt - Men's
review.reviewBody: I really like it. It's become a T-shirt I look forward to wearing so I'm back for more!
review.name: Nice shirt

review.itemreviewed: Merino 150 Tech Lite Polar Paddle T-Shirt - Men's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Overall the shirt will do what you are buying it for. It's not a fashion shirt that you will wear in daily life to look good. It's a shirt you will take on long term travel or doing outdoor adventures and it fits and looks like that. I will say it doesn't look bad, I would wear it out in town while traveling, but if you're looking for something that you'll wear to look good in daily this ain't it.
review.name: It's what you're expecting

review.itemreviewed: Merino 150 Tech Lite Polar Paddle T-Shirt - Men's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] These shirts are ultra comfortable and can be worn as an undershirt or a T-shirt, sporting attractive graphics.
review.name: Nice T-shirt and/or undershirt

review.itemreviewed: Merino 150 Tech Lite Polar Paddle T-Shirt - Men's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] They fit like a classic T-shirt, don't wrinkle, itch or stink.
review.name: Best everyday & workout shirts!

review.itemreviewed: Merino 150 Tech Lite Polar Paddle T-Shirt - Men's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Really like the fit on me. A little itchy at first, but it gets better.
review.name: Love it....so far.

name: Merino 150 Tech Lite Polar Paddle T-Shirt - Men's

description: Buy the Jetboil Sumo Stove online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Sumo Stove
hasVariant.description: Buy the Jetboil Sumo Stove online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Have had all other sizes off Jetboil pots that's all work great in all conditions and this one is no exception.
review.name: From Iceland

review.reviewBody: Perfection! The regulated burner and large volume make it well worth the space it takes up.
review.name: Everything you need if you have room for it.

review.reviewBody: Works well and is consistent.  I've used it while camping on a few trips and even once in the backyard to make breakfast outside.  Heats up the water super fast.
Awesome product for 4+ days backcountry camping. Heats super quick and holds fuel container saving pack space!
review.name: Jetboil Sumo

review.reviewBody: Works great- Easy to put up and take down makes it easy to put into the day pack
review.name: Works great  easy to put up and take down

review.reviewBody: It gets water hot quick in cold weather. Compact and easy to use.

I recently purchased 2 Sumo Jet Boils, I tried mine 3 times at home at home to get familiar with the product, it worked just fine. I took it on a fishing trip to heat lunch up on my boat, my wife thought it was a neat idea until the heat shield caught fire and completely melted around the cooker. A small piece of melting plastic landed on the floor of my boat, just a small burn mark.
review.name: Melted heat shield

review.reviewBody: Works great.  Purchased this to use while camping with my sons Scout Troop.  Boils water quickly, easy to clean, light weight.  This is a big cup it is tight when trying to fit in a backpack, but it was what I was expecting.  All the parts fit easily inside to keep everything together.

This jetboil functions exactly like advertised. It is perfect......if youre cooking for 5. Most of the meals I use this for calls for 12 oz.of water to be boiled. The cup holds a lot more than that so I would like a smaller cup in exchange for the lighter weight. That being said, it worked exactly as expected.
review.name: A little too big

review.reviewBody: amazing For me and friends or when I am with the kids - heat up lots of water fast!

name: Sumo Stove

review.itemreviewed: TM-2 Double BOA Snowboard Boot - 2024 - Women's
review.reviewBody: I've had many versions of this boot over the years and this is my first time riding in a BOA style boot and it's amazing. So easy to adjust, even while on the mountain. My toes tend to get really cold but I like to tighten my boots really tight for a stiffer fit and the boa enables me to adjust on the fly if I need some more circulation to my toes on the chairlift. The boots run true to size. The first couple times I wore the boots I was mildly uncomfortable but after that break in period they started feeling really good. I will probably bring them in to be heat molded before next season for a better fit.
review.name: Great all mountain boots

name: TM-2 Double BOA Snowboard Boot - 2024 - Women's

review.reviewBody: I moved over from Nike running shoes to Saucony and never looked back.  I’m not thrilled with the fit for these  shoes but will definitely use them on some flatter trail runs.  In my opinion, not a racing shoe.
review.name: I love Saucony But not thrilled with the fit..
comment: We appreciate your feedback. Thank you.

review.reviewBody: Fantastic shoe. I was nervous at the possibility of transitioning to this shoe after the Endorphin Edge was discontinued but I truly feel that it is a notable improvement. Better comfort, grip and wear in comparison to the Edge. I bought 2 pairs and will probably buy more. Wide foot trail runner averaging 6-12 mile distances, hailing from the desert.
review.name: Endorphin Rift is the best trail shoe I have owned

review.reviewBody: I bought these a few months ago and they great comfortable super light and good traction for trail running or walking throughout the trails…
review.name: Good shoe

review.reviewBody: Really didn’t look like any endorphin I have had and I had a few.
review.name: Strange design for an Endorphin

review.reviewBody: I really wanted to like the shoe, but i didn’t get past the aesthetics. The huge Saucony logo in the image shows black, which would make it a little more subtle. The logo on the actual shoes however is light grey. Very frustrating.
review.name: Actual shoe not as pictured
comment: We appreciate your feedback. Thank you.

review.reviewBody: I bought these last winter. They don't protect as well from the cold as the Peregrine Ice and lacing the forefoot  doesn't get very snug. The other downside is that the outsole began shedding/peeling it's "paint" colour almost immediately - a cosmetic flaw. But I'm delighted with the fit, especially the overall support and heel snugness. And they're a fast shoe! Last weekend I shaved over a minute off my time on a 9km trail race. Being 64 years old, I doubt that I'm getting much faster. LOL So these shoes are making a difference when it comes to speed. I quite like them and would buy again as a summer trail shoe. Hoping Saucony will address some of the shortfalls, which are relatively minor.
review.name: Not perfect but pretty good ... and fast, too!

review.reviewBody: Not comfortable. The design will make your toes curl up at the end. This gave me an unexpected foot injury.  The black base of the shoe is only thinly coated in black so it will gets scratches to show white. Why didn't you make it all black?
review.name: Unexpectedly Painful
comment: We appreciate your feedback. Thank you.

review.reviewBody: Very comfortable and they look great I stand a lot and my feet felt great all day
review.name: Great style and fit

review.reviewBody: I have run in the Saucony Endorphin Speed, Edge, Shift, Rift, exodus ultra, and peregrine.  The Rift is by far my favourite. The only thing that could make it better is a slightly lower heel to toe drop. Don’t change the upper. It is perfect!
review.name: As close to perfect as any shoe I’ve tried

review.reviewBody: 4 and a half stars would be more appropriate.  GREAT shoe, but the best shoe is a different pair of Saucony's I have!  I officiate girls Lacrosse and the weight and cushion of this shoe is awesome.  The only negative I have is with breaking them in the back of the shoe is a bit high and while working to break them in has caused blisters.  Once fully broken in, they are the best shoes I have had for running up and down the field.
review.name: Lacrosse Official

name: Endorphin Rift Shoe - Men's

review.reviewBody: I bought these to help keep me warm on chilly days and these tights do not disappoint.  I purchased a large and they fit perfect.  I’ve worn them when the temps have been in the mid 40’s and they kept me toasty warm.  The fabric on the front of the quads blocks chilly winds and the fleece lining keeps my legs happy.  I was afraid the sizing would be off because I’ve been told Castelli runs small but these fit me well.  Love these tights!!!
review.name: Best purchase ever!

review.reviewBody: I am a competitive cyclist for 20 years and have frequently ridden in Castelli bibs/shorts.  However, the padding in these tights seemed excessive and way too large (larger than usual), and did not seem to anatomically fit.  For reference, I always purchase size small in Castelli  - but unfortunately the padding was just too much so returning.
review.name: The padding does not fit adequately

review.reviewBody: This blue is so unique and a good change from boring black cycling gear.  But the design has a seam that is right at the back of your knee and tends to rub. Bad place to put it.  I wore them on a 5 hour ride and was uncomfortable. Tried them on a shorter ride and the same problem.  Disappointed as they?re not cheap.  The rise in the back is great. They?re warm but not as warm as I expected. Got the matching jacket and it?s definitely not warm even with base layers; wind goes right through. Overall disappointed and wish I could return.
review.name: Beautiful color poor design

review.reviewBody: Nice fitting tights that keep you warm, but size up one.  Castelli tends to run small
review.name: love

review.reviewBody: I love these pants! I got really into cycling this summer and didn't want to stop as we head into this winter, so I got these pants, and they have not disappointed. They're the perfect fit and have the right padding in all the right places. I'm excited to use these pants all winter long!
review.name: Game Changer
comment: I love the fit of these and they are the best tights I own but at 37 degrees my thighs were cold.

name: Sorpasso RoS Tight - Women's

review.reviewBody: I bought these shoes on sale after wanting them for over a year, and I was not disappointed 😁 The arch support in these is spectacular!!! My feet were very comfortable all day yesterday. They were VERY squeaky when I took them out of the box, but I ran up and down my street, wearing them, and the squeakiness went away pretty fast. Other reviews said that they gave people blisters, and while i could definitely see that being a problem for some people, it was not an issue for me. These shoes are super cute and very comfortable for the whole school day.
review.name: My toes are happy

review.reviewBody: These boots are on the narrow side, but the leather is soft and flexible so even with slightly wider feet I'm comfortable in them.  The soles have very high arches focused in a small area on the foot, which feels a little unusual, but they work for my feet (I need substantial arch support).
review.name: Fields Lace Waterproof Boot
comment: Thanks for the awesome 5-stars Kirsten!

review.reviewBody: I love my new boots! They are warm and oh so comfortable. They also look great! Haven’t tested them against water yet but I have no doubt that they will hold up to the test.
review.name: Love!
comment: Style and comfort! How could you go wrong!

review.reviewBody: Love these boots. True to size. Comfortable right from the box.
review.name: Just buy them
comment: Thanks for the love Kimmi!

review.reviewBody: It's a cute boot! However they are darker in person than shown in the pictures provided for the color smoke. They are also a heavier boot which is okay if that's what you are looking for, I unfortunately bought them for my elderly mom.
comment: We appreciate your feedback. Thank you.

review.reviewBody: Love these boots! Comfy, stylish and waterproof - exactly want I wanted!
review.name: Great boots!
comment: Thanks for the love Amy!

review.reviewBody: While it is a gorgeous boots, it is rubbing up and down on my heels and I’m suffering from blisters.
comment: We appreciate your feedback. Thank you.

review.reviewBody: After becoming a Chacos convert, when I needed to get a boot that I could wear on outings in NW Pennsylvania/Eastern NY where a day trip could include boutique shopping, hiking through bog, and then dinner on a terrace overlooking one of the Finger Lakes. Not only do these boots look good enough for that, the comfort is exceptional. I just got back from a trip where I had 12-hr travel days and many connections and steps to get from NW PA to SW CA. I can confidently tell you that these were just as solid and stylish whether shufti-ing bags from Terminal 7 to Terminal 4 when switching airlines, or hiking in the hills over the San Andreas Fault. I love you, Chaco Fields Boot. You are made for walkin'.
review.name: If only Nancy Sinatra had lived to walk in these
comment: Thanks for the great feedback!

review.reviewBody: Cute comfortable and goes with a host of items. So far so good!
review.name: Cute!
comment: Thanks for the awesome 5-stars Jess!

review.reviewBody: I love these boots. They are so sturdy and can tell they'll continue to look great for years to come. The arch is fairly aggressive, similar to the sandal. I've had some chaco boots in the past that I ended up switching out the footbed for something more supportive, but I do not need to do that with this pair! They are SO cute.
review.name: LOVE!
comment: We love the love!

name: Fields Lace Waterproof Boot - Women's

hasVariant.name: O'riginal 2/1mm Jacket - Men's

review.reviewBody: I am 5’10”, 185#, 33” waist, with a 39.5” chest, which put me straddling Medium and Large sizes. Since wetsuits are supposed to be tight in order to keep out water, do stretch over time, and definitely in the water, I went with the Medium even though my waist size was a Large based on the sizing guide. By selecting the Medium, I preferenced chest size over waist and am glad I did. The Medium fits exactly as a new wetsuit should fit and the jacket, which feels exactly like a thin wetsuit, doesn’t ride up when I paddle, which is perfect. I am happy with it and it feels great. I like the way O’Neill wetsuits fit my athletic build and the quality always feels premium despite the basic price. This jacket makes me look forward to the water getting colder here in Florida.
review.name: Fantastic Wetsuit Top

name: O'riginal 2/1mm Jacket - Men's

review.reviewBody:
At first I was really disappointed with this seat post. On my first ride with my 2020 stump jumper evo the seat came undone. I installed it correctly with the correct torque. What I noticed was that the adjustment bolt kept loosening. PRO TIP: add blue locktite to the bolt. Use an actual torque wrench and tighten to 12 nm. After doing this it has been rock solid. 

The seat post is beautifully crafted and extremely light weight. The matte finish is a nice touch as well. Adjustment is extremely easy. I would not hesitate to buy this post again.
review.name: Zipp 34.6 mm Carbon Seat Post
comment: Having this issue as well during cyclocross. Will have to try the locktite.

name: SL Speed Carbon Seatpost

hasVariant.description: Buy the Sportful Matchy Short-Sleeve Jersey - Men's online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: This jersey has a race or aero cut but it’s slightly more generous than others. It’s not skin-tight or painted on which is nice for us more “experienced” enthusiast cyclists. In other words, I’m 53 years old and I’m not so skinny anymore, especially around the midsection which is where this jersey adds a little more space. I’m 5’9” and 155 pounds and the size large is a perfect fit. This tracks with the other Sportful jersey I own (the Monocrom) which is also a large. I also wear large in Castelli but a medium in more American-sized brands like Pearl Izumi and Hincapie. The jersey is very soft and comfortable and I really like the longer sleeves which come almost to my elbows. The fabric is more of a regular weight fabric as opposed to one that is made for the hottest weather. Those tend to have some mesh areas on it. That being said, I live in SW Florida and I wear this jersey during the hottest time of the year without issue. I can also wear this during the Florida winter so it’s a very versatile fabric for where I live. If I have one complaint about this jersey it’s that the zipper pull could be longer and I’m a little worried about the overall quality of the zipper. That being said, the zipper has worked great so far. I can zip and unzip while riding without issue so perhaps this concern is unwarranted. I paid $60 for this jersey on sale but it’s worth full retail price. It’s an all-round great looking jersey at an outstanding price and I will buy another.
review.name: great fit, great value

name: Matchy Short-Sleeve Jersey - Men's

review.reviewBody: I ran half marathon with this and was super light and effective. I’ve since then washed it couple times and still looks brand new
review.name: Comfortable

review.reviewBody: I am 5’6” ~140lbs 34B. I ordered this in both the small and medium as I was kind of in between. I also ordered some unisex vests in xs. The unisex vests fit great circumference wise and in the arm holes but the material was rough on the skin. I loved the fabric of the women’s vest and the long tube bottles but the arm holes are way too small. The medium was too large around for me to cinch it any tighter so it flopped around while running. The small fit around my chest perfectly but the arm holes were soo tight and restrictive. please consider opening up the arms more towards the unisex fit as I am a very normal build and this does not fit.
review.name: Wanted to love but fit was poor
comment: Hi, thank you for sharing your thoughts with us. We always strive to improve! Your feedback has been helpful for us!

review.reviewBody: The vest itself if comfortable. It’s the refillable straws sticking up near the face that need taming.  Perhaps loops to keep them secure.  They bounce around.  Very annoying.  Might need to see something together to do this myself.
review.name: It’s ok
comment: Hello, we sincerely appreciate your feedback. We'll keep your case in mind as we constantly make changes to improve!

review.reviewBody: Got for my wife and she absolutely loves it. Perfect fit to skin, probably would have been good to add bigger loops on the back for quiver adjustable button
review.name: Loving it

review.reviewBody: Really pleased with my purchase - tested it out on a 20 mile run and found it really comfortable. Was a little worried about the bottles as some reviews had mentioned they dug in a little because of the slightly stiffer base, but this wasn't a problem for me. I'm a slim 5ft 3in small busted female and bought XS and it's perfect.
review.name: So comfortable

review.reviewBody: This is the best bag for cycling,it stretches so you can just keep putting stuff in and it doesn’t move around.I’ve not used it in the summer yet but can’t wait (every bag makes you sweat) definitely recommend 👍
review.name: Cycling backpack

review.reviewBody: I’m loving this pack so far. It’s really streamlined so while it has tons of room for items, it doesn’t feel bulky. Nothing moves around while running.  I fit just under the max size for medium, and only the medium was in stock so that’s what I’ve got. However I didn’t take into consideration my measurements when wearing many winter layers. So it’s a little on the small side now, but still fits. But I’ll need it more in the summer when I’ve only got the one layer so I think it will fit perfectly then! Just remember to measure with all the layers that you’d be wearing a lot before making a size choice.
review.name: Tons of room without bulk

review.reviewBody: feels good for a long runs very confi, love that have a lot a pockets
review.name: best running bag

review.reviewBody: I bought this vest a couple months ago; have now done a good number of long runs with it and am very happy with it. I particularly like the snug fit.
review.name: Very happy with the purchase

review.reviewBody: Since I have my Sense PRO10 I ˋm not affraid of being thursty anymore.
review.name: Fits perfectly

review.itemreviewed: Kento Pro High GTX Mountaineering Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: These were my main hiking boots I used for the 25 day Snowman Trek in Bhutan. The boots are comfortable, provided good support and are very well made. My feet stayed dry and with socks and liners I never had any blisters.
review.name: Great boots for tough terrain

review.itemreviewed: Kento Pro High GTX Mountaineering Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: These boots are a really good product for the price. Keeps feet dry and warm. And pairs nicely with Grivel G12 evo new matic crampons.
review.name: Great boots

review.itemreviewed: Kento Pro High GTX Mountaineering Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: Excellent foot protection, fit is excellent for me (wider fore foot, narrow heel). I used these for some summer mountaineering, a full season of wildfire fighting, and now are my warm-day winter  boot when I need crampons. Highly recommend, they are so good I'm tempted to buy a second pair to have as backup. Oh almost forgot, they have excellent rear ward motion, ie you can point your toes to step down which really takes the strain off my knees on long steep descents
review.name: Great fit and durability

review.itemreviewed: Kento Pro High GTX Mountaineering Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody:
I've used these boots for three challenging scrambles in the Canadian Rockies and they have been fantastic. The grip on rock and the control in scree and crud have been outstanding. 

Mammut has other options for hiking and backpacking but for scrambling and beginning mountaineering these are outstanding, buy these boots
review.name: Scrambling Supreme

review.itemreviewed: Kento Pro High GTX Mountaineering Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: These boots had minimal break in time, kept my feet dry when the boots themselves were soaked, and preformed really well on snow as well as rock. They pair really well with my BD Stinger crampons (which I modified with a Petzel Fil Flex). Super happy with them and would highly recommend.
review.name: Mammut Kento

review.itemreviewed: Kento Pro High GTX Mountaineering Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: They fit well, grip many different terrain and ice, and they're warm and water proof.

review.itemreviewed: Kento Pro High GTX Mountaineering Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: I love the way Salewa boots fit my narrow feet.  They are the best fitting brand I have found.  However there was a Manufacturing issue with my first pair. The lace rings failed to stay in position and Salewa admitted that it was a manufacturing defect and gladly replaced the boot.  When my new boot came I was surprised that I had the same issue.  They gladly replaced them again.  And the third pair had the exact same issue right out of the box.  I am waiting for those replacements to come.  I would not recommend this particular boot because it has a manufacturing defect and needs to be recalled and disposed of.

review.itemreviewed: Kento Pro High GTX Mountaineering Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: These boots are solid!  Stiff and great for backcountry hunting/hiking.  Keep feet warm in winter conditions and tread was great.  Fits foot well and light and comfortable for multiple mile hikes.
review.name: Solid Mountaineering Boot

review.itemreviewed: Kento Pro High GTX Mountaineering Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: The Mammut Kento Pro is great for off trail work, scrambling, and high angle work.
review.name: Great boot for hybrid mountaineering

review.itemreviewed: Kento Pro High GTX Mountaineering Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: Took these boots up 20k of vertical on Mt Rainier and Glacier Peak in the last month.  I struggle with heel slip and rubbing in all La Sportivas and Scarpa models I've tried, but these fixed my problems.  Would definitely recommend to anyone with similar issue looking for a solid mountaineering boot.
review.name: Great boot for small heels and thin ankles

name: Kento Pro High GTX Mountaineering Boot - Men's

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I like it. It's light, it doesn't stink, good color, good fit and keeps you 7.5/10 warm. It does leave your neck exposed if you don't have a high collar so be aware of that but the design is great.
review.name: Very good product. Would love a longer and slightly heavier

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Great product. Thin enough that you can breathe comfortably but still does the job of keeping you warm. Will happily repurchase in the future!
review.name: Oasis Balaklava

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Bought this for my girlfriend as she learns to Ski this year. She says its perfect especially for when you get hungry on the lift you dont even need to take it off.
review.name: My Girlfriend loves it

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I pull one of these on every morning and put a hat on top of it before I head out for a 14 mile walk/hike/jog on the hilly roads in my rural Northeast town. Years and years ago I bought one of these and I didn't really know what to do with it. But recently I realized it could come in handy. Keeps bugs off my face and out of my hair and ears. Keeps my neck warm. I came back here a few times and just bought more because it is getting cold and my nose runs and my eyes water. I pretty much peel them off and throw them in the laundry. I wash all clothes and things on cold, then I hang almost everything on a drying rack. These things take no time at all to dry. When I can I will buy two more!
review.name: I would buy this product again and agsin

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I will use this when biking and walking because it's thin and comfortable and fits under a hat or a bike helmet. It really adds warmth even as thin as it is because it's wool. Ready for winter in Chicago now!
review.name: nice coverage

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] The perfect way to keep my face and ears warm in the Pacific Northwest Fall and early winter where Temperatures don't get lower than 35°. If active It may perform well and even colder scenarios
review.name: Excellent for mild winter climates

review.reviewBody: This balaclava is light but warm; comfortable under a helmet or toque. I especially like that the design helps prevent my glasses from fogging up when I need full face coverage.
review.name: A welcome addition for cold winter walking

review.reviewBody: My kids (5 and 7) both wear these when they are outside for hours at a time in the brutal winter in Maine. The design is wonderful--easy to pull up over the cheeks and nose, or comfortable to wear under the chin. They wear them under hats and hoods. I highly recomend!
review.name: Fantastic for Children

review.reviewBody:
Warm enough by itself for temperatures in the 20s. Below that would need extra coverage. 
Very comfortable enjoy wearing it.
review.name: Does the job

review.reviewBody: Fit nice for my head - an average woman head.
review.name: Tight fit, more for women

name: Oasis Balaclava

review.reviewBody: Looking at this shirt the waffle fabric makes you think it’ll be thick- it’s so light I really dig this!! I love a good hoodie but wanted something more versatile. Begs the question, why no tshirt?!? I’ve become a huge fan of Backcountry clothes in the last few years- ski jacket, base layers, now this sun shirt. I could see how super slim guys would want something more tapered. Don’t hesitate to pay 1/3 the price of Patawhaaa???

review.reviewBody: A lot of Backcountry's recent clothes have a nice modern fit to them and I was hoping to see that again on this piece but it turned out to be boxy and traditional.  I really like the fabric but I'm tall and thin and this shirt was too short and wide for me.
review.name: Close to Awesome

review.reviewBody: Great option for those that don't want a hood on their sun protection shirt. This is my go to synthetic shirt for hiking, paddling, & even hanging out at camp.
review.name: Sun Protection & Versatile use

review.reviewBody: The Tahoe Sun Hoodie has been my go to UPF shirt from three seasons now but I am stoked to finally have it in a crew version as well. The lightweight fabric is quick drying and great for every activity on the water but also perfect for those Spring ski tours
review.name: The best UPF shirt now in a Crew

review.reviewBody: I have enjoyed using this pack for a couple proper backpacking trips and used it for city traveling. Plenty of storage, loads of adjustments for your comfort, nice design and materials and finally multiple ways to load the pack make this a great choice.
review.name: Love it

review.reviewBody: My girlfriend ordered the extended fit for me not because I'm morbidly obese but because my shoulders are 3x the size of the normal person. I have a bodybuilder frame and she decided to give it a go. Just wow fits my shoulders perfectly with a lot of extra room if I decide to go on a McDonald's and deep fried Twinkie diet. I always get the heaviest bag because my girlfriend can't handle more than 25lbs. My bag was around 60lbs on a 3 day hike. Comfort all day and room to spare!
review.name: Solid choice for a long hike
